page.title: 02HOUSING IN CHARD
page.content: Chard was originally a Saxon village.A fire in 1577 destroyed many houses. The newest development is an estate called Glynswood,which covers 40 acres on the Northern outskirts of the town.The developers have been working on Glynswood for 20 years. There are 23 different designs of homes,but different materials are used to make them individual.3-bedroomed houses cost Â£39,950,3-bedroom bungalows cost Â£38,500;2-bedroom bungalows cost Â£36,700.They also have flats and are planning to build more. In future years they are planning to have more facilities such as parks,shops and playing fields.
